meanings.definition: A person or thing that wheels.
meanings.sent1: The little boy loved playing with his toy wheelers.
meanings.sent2: The delivery truck had a team of wheelers unloading the packages.
meanings.sent3: The wheelers in the circus were always spinning plates on sticks.
meanings.sent4: She was the wheelers of the family, always organizing outings and trips.
meanings.sent5: The wheelers in the factory kept the production line moving smoothly.

meanings.definition: A vehicle with wheels, such as a bicycle or car.
meanings.sent1: The bicycle shop had a variety of wheelers for sale.
meanings.sent2: The wheelers parked in front of the house gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The wheelers in the parking lot seemed to be having a race.
meanings.sent4: The old car was a reliable wheeler, never breaking down on long trips.
meanings.sent5: The wheelers on the highway zoomed past, leaving a trail of dust behind.
